004package kut;
005
006import java.io.*;
007import java.nio.file.Files;
008import java.nio.file.StandardCopyOption;
009import java.nio.charset.Charset;
010
011/**
012 * File system management.<p>
013 * Paths must be writen in Linux-Unix format (in Windows inclusive).
014 */
015public class File {
016  static String toSo (String path) {
017    return java.io.File.separatorChar != '/'
018      ? path.replace('/', java.io.File.separatorChar)
019      : path
020    ;
021  }
022
023  /**
024   * Open 'path' for append.
025   * @param path.
026   * @return FileOutputStream.
027   * @throws IllegalStateException If 'path' is not found.
028   */
029  public static FileOutputStream aopen (String path) {
030    try {
031      return new FileOutputStream(toSo(path), true);
032    } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
033      throw new IllegalStateException (e);
034    }
035  }
036
037  /**
038   * NO IMPLEMENTED.<p>
039   * Throws a IOException ever.
040   * @param path Path.
041   * @throws IOException Ever.
042   */
043  public static void cd (String path) throws IOException {
044    throw new IOException("Function not implemented");
045  }
046
047  /**
048   * Close file.
049   * @param f File
050   */
051  public static void close (Closeable f) {
052    try {
053      f.close();
054    } catch (IOException e) {
055      throw new IllegalStateException (e);
056    }
057  }
058
059  /**
060   * Returns the working directory.
061   * @return The working directory.
062   */
063  public static String cwd () {
064    return toSo(System.getProperty("user.dir"));
065  }
066
067  /**
068   * Copy a file.<p>
069   * NOTE: Target will be overwritte if already exists.
070   * @param source Can be a regular file or a directory.
071   * @param target <ul>
072   *        <li> If source is a directory, target must be a directory.
073   *        <li> If source is a regular file, target can be a directory or a
074   *             regular file.
075   *      </ul>
076   * @throws IllegalStateException If copy fails.
077   */
078  public static void copy (String source, String target) {
079    if (isDirectory(source)) {
080      if (!isDirectory(target))
081        throw new IllegalStateException("'" + target + "' is not a directory.");
082      String tdir = Path.cat(target, Path.base(source));
083      del(tdir);
084      mkdir(tdir);
085      for (String fname : dir(source)) copy(Path.cat(source, fname), tdir);
086    } else {
087      if (isDirectory(target)) target = Path.cat(target, Path.base(source));
088      try {
089        Files.copy(
090          new java.io.File(toSo(source)).toPath(),
091          new java.io.File(toSo(target)).toPath(),
092          StandardCopyOption.REPLACE_EXISTING,
093          StandardCopyOption.COPY_ATTRIBUTES
094        );
095      } catch (IOException e) {
096        throw new IllegalStateException(e);
097      }
098    }
099  }
100
101  /**
102   * Deletes 'path'.<p>
103   * If 'path' is a directory, 'del' deletes it and all its subdirectories,
104   * although they are not empty.<br>
105   * If 'path' does not exists, 'del' do nothing.
106   * @param path Path.
107   */
108  public static void del (String path) {
109    if (isDirectory(path))
110      for (String fname : dir(path)) del(Path.cat(path, fname));
111
112    new java.io.File(toSo(path)).delete();
113  }
114
115  /**
116   * Returns base names of files and directories of 'path'.
117   * @param path Path.
118   * @return List of file name.
119   */
120  public static String[] dir (String path) {
121    if (!isDirectory(path))
122      throw new IllegalStateException("'" + path + "' is not a directory.");
123    return new java.io.File(toSo(path)).list();
124  }
125
126  /**
127   * Returns 'true' if 'path' is a file, link or directory.
128   * @param path Path.
129   * @return 'true' if 'path' is a file, link or directory.
130   */
131  public static boolean exists (String path) {
132    return Files.exists(new java.io.File(toSo(path)).toPath());
133  }
134
135  /**
136   * Returns the user home directory.
137   * @return The user home directory.
138   */
139  public static String home () {
140    return toSo(System.getProperty("user.home"));
141  }
142
143  /**
144   * Returns 'true' if 'path' is a directory.
145   * @param path Path.
146   * @return 'true' if 'path' is a directory.
147   */
148  public static boolean isDirectory (String path) {
149    return Files.isDirectory(new java.io.File(toSo(path)).toPath());
150  }
151
152  /**
153   * Returns 'true' if 'path' is a link.
154   * @param path Path.
155   * @return 'true' if 'path' is a link.
156   */
157  public static boolean isLink (String path) {
158    return Files.isSymbolicLink(new java.io.File(toSo(path)).toPath());
159  }
160
161  /**
162   * Returns 'true' if 'path' is a regular file.<p>
163   * NOTE: If 'path' is a link to a regular file, it returns 'true'.
164   * @param path Path.
165   * @return 'true' if 'path' is a regular file.
166   */
167  public static boolean isRegular (String path) {
168    return Files.isRegularFile(new java.io.File(toSo(path)).toPath());
169  }
170
171  /**
172   * Creates the directory 'path' and its parent directories if is necessary.<p>
173   * NOTE: If path already exists 'mkdir' do nothing.
174   * @param path Path
175   */
176  public static void mkdir (String path) {
177    new java.io.File(toSo(path)).mkdirs();
178  }
179
180  /**
181   * Creates a symbol link from 'link' to 'fpath'.
182   * @param filePath Source file path.
183   * @param linkPath Link path.
184   * @throws IllegalStateException If 'mklink' fails.
185   */
186  public static void mklink (String filePath, String linkPath) {
187    try {
188      Files.createSymbolicLink(
189        new java.io.File(toSo(linkPath)).toPath(),
190        new java.io.File(toSo(filePath)).toPath()
191      );
192    } catch (IOException e) {
193      throw new IllegalStateException(e);
194    }
195  }
196
197  /**
198   * Reads the complete UTF-8 text file 'path'.
199   * @param path Path.
200   * @return String
201   * @throws IllegalStateException If the function fails.
202   */
203  public static String read (String path) {
204    try {
205      return Files.readString(new java.io.File(toSo(path)).toPath());
206    } catch (IOException e) {
207      throw new IllegalStateException(e);
208    }
209  }
210
211  /**
212   * Reads 'buf' bytes of 'f'.<p>
213   * When 'f' is at end, returns a bytes with no element.<p>
214   * NOTE: 'f' was open with 'rbopen'.
215   * @param f Open file.
216   * @param buf Bytes number to read.
217   * @return Bytes read.
218   * @throws IllegalStateException If the function fails.
219   */
220  public static byte[] readBytes (FileInputStream f, int buf) {
221    try {
222      byte[] bs = Bytes.mk(buf);
223      int n = f.read(bs);
224      if (n == -1) return Bytes.mk(0);
225      if (n != buf) return Bytes.take(bs, n);
226      return bs;
227    } catch (IOException e) {
228      throw new IllegalStateException(e);
229    }
230  }
231
232  /**
233   * Returns the next line read from a 'UTF-8' text file 'f' or 'Opt.none' if
234   * there are no more lines to read.<p>
235   * NOTE: 'f' was open with 'ropen'.
236   * @param f Open file.
237   * @return Line without line feed or carriage return.
238   * @throws IllegalStateException If the function fails.
239   */
240  public static Opt<String> readLine (BufferedReader f) {
241    try {
242      String l = f.readLine();
243      return l == null ? Opt.none() : Opt.some(l);
244    } catch (IOException e) {
245      throw new IllegalStateException(e);
246    }
247  }
248
249  /**
250   * Ranames (changes) source to target.
251   * @param source Current path.
252   * @param target New path.
253   * @throws IllegalStateException If the function fails.
254   */
255  public static void rename (String source, String target) {
256    try {
257      Files.move(
258        new java.io.File(toSo(source)).toPath(),
259        new java.io.File(toSo(target)).toPath()
260      );
261    } catch (IOException e) {
262      throw new IllegalStateException(e);
263    }
264  }
265
266  /**
267   * Open 'path' for reading as 'UTF-8' text, using 'readLine'.
268   * @param path Path
269   * @return File open.
270   * @throws IllegalStateException If the function fails.
271   */
272  public static BufferedReader ropen (String path) {
273    try {
274      return new BufferedReader(new FileReader(
275        new java.io.File(toSo(path))
276      ));
277    } catch (IOException e) {
278      throw new IllegalStateException(e);
279    }
280  }
281
282  /**
283   * Open 'path' for reading as binary file, using 'readBytes'.
284   * @param path Path
285   * @return File open.
286   * @throws IllegalStateException If the function fails.
287   */
288  public static FileInputStream rbopen (String path) {
289    try {
290      return new FileInputStream(
291        new java.io.File(toSo(path))
292      );
293    } catch (IOException e) {
294      throw new IllegalStateException(e);
295    }
296  }
297
298  /**
299   * Returns size of 'path'.
300   * @param path Path.
301   * @return File size.
302   */
303  public static long size (String path) {
304    return new java.io.File(toSo(path)).length();
305  }
306
307  /**
308   * Returns time of last modification of 'path'.
309   * @param path Path.
310   * @return Milliseconds since the epoch (1970-01-01T00:00:00Z)
311   * @throws IllegalStateException If the function fails.
312   */
313  public static long tm (String path) {
314    try {
315      return Files.getLastModifiedTime(
316        new java.io.File(toSo(path)).toPath()
317      ).toMillis();
318    } catch (IOException e) {
319      throw new IllegalStateException(e);
320    }
321  }
322
323  /**
324   * Returns a random name for a file in "dir" with the scheme 'fname' +
325   * "xxxxxxxx".<p>
326   * The return is checked that does not match any existing file.<p>
327   * If 'dir' is an empty string, the current directoy is used.
328   * @param dir Directory to get the name.
329   * @param fname Start of filename (Can not contains slash [/]).
330   * @return A unic name.
331   */
332  public static String tmp (String dir, String fname) {
333    dir = dir == "" ? "." : dir;
334    for (;;) {
335      String name = fname + Cryp.genk(8).replace("/", "-");
336      if (!exists(Path.cat(dir, name))) return name;
337    }
338  }
339
340  /**
341   * Returns a random name for a file in the file temporary directory with the
342   * scheme 'fname' + "xxxxxxxx".<p>
343   * The return is checked that does not match any existing file.
344   * @param fname Start of filename (Can not contains slash [/]).
345   * @return A unic name.
346   */
347  public static String tmp (String fname) {
348    return tmp("/tmp", fname);
349  }
350
351  /**
352   * Open 'path' for writing.
353   * @param path Path.
354   * @return Open file.
355   * @throws IllegalStateException If the function fails.
356   */
357  public static FileOutputStream wopen (String path) {
358    try {
359      return new FileOutputStream(toSo(path));
360    } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
361      throw new IllegalStateException (e);
362    }
363  }
364
365  /**
366   * Writes UTF-8 'text' in 'path'.<p>
367   * If 'path' exists, it is overwriten.
368   * @param path Path.
369   * @param text Text to write.
370   * @throws IllegalStateException If the function fails.
371   */
372  public static void write (String path, String text) {
373    try {
374      Files.writeString(new java.io.File(toSo(path)).toPath(), text);
375    } catch (IOException e) {
376      throw new IllegalStateException (e);
377    }
378  }
379
380  /**
381   * Writes bs in 'f'.
382   * @param f Open file.
383   * @param bs Bytes to write.
384   * @throws IllegalStateException If the function fails.
385   */
386  public static void writeBytes (FileOutputStream f, byte[] bs) {
387    try {
388      f.write(bs);
389    } catch (IOException e) {
390      throw new IllegalStateException (e);
391    }
392  }
393
394  /**
395   * Writes UTF-8 'text' in 'f'.
396   * @param f Open file.
397   * @param text Text to write.
398   * @throws IllegalStateException If the function fails.
399   */
400  public static void writeText (FileOutputStream f, String text) {
401    try {
402      f.write(text.getBytes("UTF-8"));
403    } catch (IOException e) {
404      throw new IllegalStateException (e);
405    }
406  }
407
408}
